result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly J. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

02:10 pm - Defendant Kimberly J. Peterson in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf14 and 14cf149.  State moves to dismiss count 2 in case 14c149 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to remaining two counts.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Hogan/Bednar/Court statement to sentencing.

11:14 am - Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf14 and 14cf149.  Hogan states rec'd call from defendant - car trouble is causing delay.  Court sets for 1:30 p.m.

02:17 pm - Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf14 and 14cf149.  Bednar believes case was resolved - Defendant is currently incarcerated in Milwaukee County.  Currently set for jury trial on February 6th.  Court authorizes warrant if defendant does not appear on the 24th.  Court removes jury trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing held June 4, 2014
Sara, ONSO Dispatch, notified to quash warrant - made voluntary appearance.

03:0 pm - Defendant Kimberly J. Peterson in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf14 and 14cf149.  Court questions defendant as to non-appearance on December 2nd - Defendant states was hospitalized.  Defendant was then scheduled for 1:30 p.m. - Defendant states got lost on the way up today.  Hogan states case is not yet resolved.  Hopes case will still be resolved prior to jury trial.  MIchlig/Hogan statement to bond.  Court quashes warrant and reinstates the $500 cash bond.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

01:31 pm - Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan in court.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf14 and 14cf149.  Hogan states does not know why defendant is not present - did have contact with defendant this past week several time over the phone.  Defendant states to Hogan was hospitalized and was going to bring documentation.  Warrant remains active.
Voluntary appearance on December 11, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
